title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.12-13 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 20-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasvait Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasa Adi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramche Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we are discussing from two verses, the twelfth and the thirteenth verses
of the Bhagavad Gita.
of the seventeenth chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Ko avrishchat tavapadam strin
Saurabheya chatushpada
Mabhuvams tvadrisha rashtre
Raghnam krishnanu vartinam
The meaning of this twelfth verse is
He, Maharaj Parikshit, repeatedly addressed and questioned the bull das
O son!
O son of Surabhi, who has cut off your three legs.
In the state of the kings who are obedient to the laws of the Supreme Personality of
God Krishna, there is no one as unhappy as you.
So Parikshit was very pained to see the condition of the bull suffering, because it had lost
three of its legs, somehow wobbling along on one leg.
So he is questioning, who has done this?
Parpot, by Srila Prabhupada, Prabhupada says in the Parpot,
The kings or the executive heads of all states must know the codes of Lord Krishna.
And the codes of Lord Krishna generally mean the Bhagavad Gita and Srimad Bhagavatam.
Two scriptures are enough.
Though there are varieties of scriptures,
many, many, many scriptures,
but for the present age of Kali Yuga,
these two scriptures are very important and enough for understanding the codes of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
The Bhagavad Gita and Bhagavad.
They are both described by Chaitanya Mahaprabhu as Krishna Katha.
Bhagavad Gita is Krishna Katha spoken by Krishna himself.
Bhagavad Gita is Krishna Katha spoken by Krishna himself.

Kalau nashtat drishamesha puranarko adhunoditaha.
Bhagavatam it is said, in Kali Yuga people have lost the vision of the goal of human
life because of the dense darkness due to the influence of Kali and this darkness is
dissipated by the Srimad Bhagavatam which is the horizon like the sun at the beginning
of Kali Yuga to give direction to all those people who have lost the direction for the
future.
Making progress in human life.
The 13th verse, aakhya hi vrishabhadram vaha sadhunam akrita agasam, atma vairupya kartaram
parthanam kirti dusanam.
Meaning of this 13th verse is, O bull, you are offenseless and thoroughly honest, therefore
I wish all good to you.
Please tell me of the perpetrator of these mutilations, which blackmailed you and made
you feel the reputation of the sons of Pritha, kirti dusanam.
So in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says, the reputation of the reign of Maharaja Ramachandra
and that of the kings who followed in the footsteps of Maharaja Ramachandra, like the
Pandavas and their descendants are never to be forgotten because in their kingdom, offenseless
and honest living beings were never in trouble.
Ramaraja, you have heard of Ramaraja?
So when Rama was ruling, everybody was happy.
People were getting all their necessities in plenty.
When Yudhishthira was ruling also, that was the situation.
So there is a correlation between the...
The...
The...
The...
The way a king governs the state or the kingdom and the...
The codes of Dharma given in the scriptures, there is a correlation.
Exactly according to the Dharma Shastra, the Samadhi rules, there is peace, prosperity,
plenty of supply, and people will be able to live very nicely.
And these are described in the authorized scriptures.
How people were living during Maharaja Yudhishthira's time is described in the Mahabharata.
How people were living during Ramachandra's time is described in the Ramayana.
So you should read that.
And they are not just stories.
They are not fiction stories.
They are facts.
That also people do not know.
They use the term mythology to describe Ramayana, Mahabharata, our ancient scriptures.
But mythology means something which is false, myth, just imaginary, which is not true.
But that is a wrong description of...
Of...
Mahabharata, Ramayana, the Puranas.
Mythology is wrong.
They are facts, historical facts, cent percent true.
Great sages performed severe tapasya in order to compile these literatures for the perfect...
For giving perfect direction.
For giving perfect direction.
For giving perfect direction.
To people in general.
So they did...
They had no business writing fiction stories.
They simply documented the facts and figures and the principles perfectly without any trace
of any mistake in these scriptures.
That is the standard of these scriptures.
They say Shastra.
They say shastra.
The bull and the cow
are the symbols of the most
offenseless living beings.
The bull and the cow
completely offenseless.
And the value of these animals
Prabhupada explains
is that even the stool and urine
of these animals are utilized
to benefit human society.
No other animal stool
except the cow
is useful for human society.
Even the human being's stool
also is not useful.
But the cows, cow dung,
gober,
gomedhya.
So that is very, very valuable.
How many ways it can be used.
Nowadays, of course,
people do not know so much.
But,
if you go to some villages
even now,
multiple ways they use
this cow dung and cow urine.
So, if the stool and the urine
are also useful for human society,
how valuable are these animals
for human society?
You can only imagine.
The descendants of the sons of Pritha,
like Maharaj Parikh,
are afraid of losing their reputation.
When,
the animals are not protected,
they don't think
they will be able to
retain the reputation
of giving proper protection
to the Praja.
But in modern days,
the leaders are not even afraid
of killing such offenseless animals.
So, therefore,
Prabhupada says,
Herein lies the difference
between the reign of pious kings
and the modern states
ruled by irresponsible executive heads
without knowledge of the codes of conduct.
The ignorance about
Dharma Shastra
is a very, very
serious lacuna
in modern society.
So, they can only rule properly
if they have proper knowledge.
And this knowledge should be based on
taking
the knowledge
from the perfect source,
not imperfect
theories.
Or speculations
given by
conditioned souls.
No.
You take knowledge from liberated souls.
So, I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
